definitions.text: not of long duration; having just (or relatively recently) come into being or been made or acquired or discovered
original and of a kind not seen before
examples: the computer produced a completely novel proof of a well-known theorem
the new men were eager to fight

definitions.text: having no previous example or precedent or parallel
other than the former one(s); different
examples: they now have a new leaders
my new car is four years old but has only 15,000 miles on it
ready to take a new direction

definitions.text: (of a new kind or fashion) gratuitously new
examples: she buys all these new-fangled machines and never uses them
New Eqyptian was the language of the 18th to 21st dynasties

definitions.text: used of a living language; being the current stage in its development
(of crops) harvested at an early stage of development; before complete maturity

examples: errors of someone new to the job
grass new washed by the rain
we are fresh out of tomatoes
